title: FDNY medical leave roll and annual totals

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

* The full list of all FDNY staff that have taken or are currently on medical leave with all metadata tracked by the data management system, including name, rank, start date, cause and pay. I ask that the records be released as a digital spreadsheet of data exported from the department's computer systems.

* Annual totals of the medical leave expenses at FDNY

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Emails and text messages sent by five FDNY chiefs

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Emails and text messages sent by five FDNY chiefs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

* All email sent by John Hodgens, John Esposito, Joe Jardin, Michael Gala and Fred Schaaf from Feb. 2 through Feb. 8.
* All text messages send and received by John Hodgens, John Esposito, Joe Jardin, Michael Gala and Fred Schaaf from Feb. 2 through Feb. 8.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh
